From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has articles on:
Lachse and Lachs (Fleisch)
Wikipedia deWikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German lahs, from Old High German lahs, from Proto-West Germanic *lahs, from Proto-Germanic *lahsaz.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /laks/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Homophones: Lacks, lax

Noun

[edit]

Lachs m (strong, genitive Lachses, plural Lachse)

  1. salmon, lox
  2. loin, backstrap, longissimus dorsi (core muscle, long back extensor muscle) of the back of slaughtered animals, especially pigs, calves, and lambs; part of the rib or chop cuts.
  3. (colloquial) dick
    Synonyms: see Thesaurus:Penis

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Lachs [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Lachs die Lachse
genitive eines des Lachses der Lachse
dative einem dem Lachs, Lachse1 den Lachsen
accusative einen den Lachs die Lachse

1Now rare, see notes.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • lachsartig
  • lachsfarben
